content:
TITLE: Configuring Firebase and Email Transport in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows where to make configuration changes in the index.js file. It requires replacing placeholders for the Firebase project ID and service account credential file path, as well as configuring the email transport.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/database/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// in index.js
<PROJECT_ID>
<PATH_TO_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_CREDENTIAL_FILE>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Firebase Configuration File
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code for setting up the Firebase configuration file with necessary credentials. This configuration connects the client-side application to your Firebase project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/auth-sessions/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const config = {
  apiKey: "...",
  authDomain: "...",
  databaseURL: "...",
  storageBucket: "...",
  messagingSenderId: "..."
};
module.exports = config;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Firebase ML Service Account and Storage
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript configuration for setting up Firebase service account credentials and storage bucket
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/machine-learning/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY = '/path/to/your/service_account_key.json';
const STORAGE_BUCKET = 'your-storage-bucket';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Node.js script for common FCM message
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Node.js script that sends a common notification message using Firebase Cloud Messaging API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/messaging/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
node index.js common-message
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Node.js script for platform-specific FCM message
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Node.js script that sends a customized notification message for different platforms using Firebase Cloud Messaging API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/messaging/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
node index.js override-message
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning and Installing the Firebase Session Management Sample
DESCRIPTION: Commands for downloading the sample application source code and installing its dependencies using git and npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/auth-sessions/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs
cd quickstart-nodejs/auth-sessions
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Firebase Session Management Demo
DESCRIPTION: Command to build and run the sample application, which launches a local server on port 3000 where the demo can be accessed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/auth-sessions/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run demo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Firebase ML Model Management CLI Commands
DESCRIPTION: Example session showing various command-line operations for managing ML models including listing, creating, updating, and deleting models
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/machine-learning/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ./manage-ml.js list
fish_detector    8716935   vision
barcode_scanner  8716959   vision
$ ./manage-ml.js new yak_detector -f ~/yak.tflite --tags vision,experimental
Uploading model to Cloud Storage...
Model uploaded and published:
yak_detector     8717019   experimental, vision
$ ./manage-ml.js new emu_detector -a projects/12345/locations/us-central1/models/ICN12345
Model uploaded and published:
emu_detector     8717033
$ ./manage-ml.js update 8717019 --remove_tags experimental
$ ./manage-ml.js delete 8716959
$ ./manage-ml.js list
fish_detector    8716935   vision
yak_detector     8717019   vision
emu_detector     8717033
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing googleapis package for Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the 'googleapis' package, which is required for the Firebase Cloud Messaging Node.js quickstart app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/messaging/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install googleapis
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Firebase ML Quickstart Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the quickstart repository and set up the ML management environment
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/machine-learning/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ git clone https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs.git
$ cd quickstart-nodejs/machine-learning
$ npm install
$ chmod u+x manage-ml.js  # Optional
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Build Verification Command
DESCRIPTION: Shell command to build and test changes locally using gulp.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
gulp
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Firebase Remote Config Template Structure in JSON
DESCRIPTION: Example template structure showing conditions for Android and iOS users with conditional welcome messages. Demonstrates how to structure parameters and conditions in a Remote Config template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/config/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "etag": "etag-<YOUR_TEMPLATE_ETAG>",
  "conditions": [
    {
      "name": "AndroidUsers",
      "expression": "device.os == 'android'",
      "tagColor": "PURPLE"
    },
    {
      "name": "iOSUsers",
      "expression": "device.os == 'ios'",
      "tagColor": "GREEN"
    }
  ],
  "parameters": {
    "welcome_message": {
      "defaultValue": {
        "value": "Welcome"
      },
      "conditionalValues": {
        "AndroidUsers": {
          "value": "Welcome Android User"
        },
        "iOSUsers": {
          "value": "Welcome iOS User"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Issue Template
DESCRIPTION: Template for submitting new issues with required information about browser, OS and steps to reproduce.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
Browser:
Browser version:
Operating system:
Operating system version:

What steps will reproduce the problem:
1.
2.
3.

What is the expected result?

What happens instead of that?

Please provide any other information below, and attach a screenshot if possible.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Commit Command
DESCRIPTION: Shell command for committing changes with the -a option to automatically add and remove edited files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git commit -a
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Branch Creation Command
DESCRIPTION: Shell command for creating a new git branch for fixes or features.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git checkout -b my-fix-branch master
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Push Command
DESCRIPTION: Shell command for pushing changes to GitHub.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git push origin my-fix-branch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Force Push Commands
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands for rebasing and force pushing updates to a pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git rebase master -i
git push origin my-fix-branch -f
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Post-Merge Cleanup Commands
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands for cleanup after pull request is merged, including deleting branches and updating master.
SOURCE: https://github.com/firebase/quickstart-nodejs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git push origin --delete my-fix-branch
git checkout master -f
git branch -D my-fix-branch
git pull --ff upstream master
```
